issue.title: Jackson 3 Support Renders Proxy callbacks property
issue.body:
jackson-databind 3.0.0 renders `callbacks` property from Spring CGLIB Proxy instances. This means that objects that are secured using Spring Security's method security will have additional properties rendered.

See the disabled test at [core/src/test/java/org/springframework/security/authorization/AuthorizationAdvisorProxyFactoryTests.java](https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-security/pull/17832/files?show-viewed-files=true#diff-428261fee3ae54a5f7d0558bd33bf3cbebb22a2602ab34f909913bb8b114fd6cR344) for a reproducer

See https://github.com/FasterXML/jackson-databind/issues/5354

body: Jackson is a low level lib. We don't normally POCs that involve 3rd party libs. Is there a way to reproduce this with needing 3rd party libs like the Spring ones?

Ok first we do need full reproduction -- test looks like almost that, just need `import`s & dependency to add in `pom.xml` ("test" dependency).

I suspect test needs to be added in 2.x to guard against regression, merge into 3.x, see if we can restore blocking.

As to changes, looks like

    src/main/java/tools/jackson/databind/introspect/DefaultAccessorNamingStrategy.java

has references to cglib from comments. So logic must have been refactored, but regression not detected.

> Jackson is a low level lib. We don't normally POCs that involve 3rd party libs. Is there a way to reproduce this with needing 3rd party libs like the Spring ones?

I'm pretty sure it can be reproduced without Spring & Spring was mentioned as context.
Our existing tests did not use actual cglib for tests tho.

Thank you for the quick replies.

> Ok first we do need full reproduction -- test looks like almost that, just need imports & dependency to add in pom.xml ("test" dependency).

The branch in the GitHub repository that I posted has a complete reproducer (it demos working with jackson2 and failing with jackson3) https://github.com/rwinch/spring-sample/tree/jackson-cglib-properties Details in the original report.

> I'm pretty sure it can be reproduced without Spring & Spring was mentioned as context.
> Our existing tests did not use actual cglib for tests tho.

I can provide a mocked test, but if Spring's support changes then the test would need to be updated.

Ah. I missed this:

    // ProxyFactory from org.springframework:spring-aop:7.0.0-RC1

Tests we include cannot really have dependencies to Spring libraries: cglib is fine. So we'd reproduction without Spring but with cglib, ideally; mock only if we have no other choice.

**EDIT**: we could have more extensive interation tests on:

https://github.com/FasterXML/jackson-integration-tests

where Spring dependencies would be ok. For what that is worth.
Sounds good. I will provide tests with no additional dependencies for jackson-databind that simulate the issue :)
Right, I appreciate your help! For fixing things, it'd be very helpful to have a jackson-databind unit test that uses cglib produced/modified value(s) that emulates Spring problem.

issue.title: Fix #5354: do not write cglibs Callback[] getCallbacks() (3.x)

repository.name: jackson-databind
repository.description: General data-binding package for Jackson (2.x): works on streaming API (core) implementation(s)

body: @cowtowncoder Thanks for getting this fixed. I noticed that the [3.0.1 milestone is open](https://github.com/FasterXML/jackson-databind/milestone/194) but the [3.0.1 tag](https://github.com/FasterXML/jackson-databind/releases/tag/jackson-databind-3.0.1) is published and [jackson-databind-3.0.1 is in central](https://central.sonatype.com/artifact/tools.jackson.core/jackson-databind/3.0.1). Should the milestone be closed?
